1.content:
Here are some races to start with:

Xexi: a race of dark green fuzzy humanoids with beady yellow eyes. They resemble a heavy set human in shape. They are tiny, about 3 millimeters tall, but are very strong and fast for their size, like ants. They live in towering colonies of several billion, but they do not have appointed leaders. Their intelligence matches that of primitive man. Also, their planet is filled with odd, more formidable beasts that the Xexi have all tamed.

Ubs: another humanoid race, but very highly advanced. Ubs have bulbous heads with no noticeable features like eyes or mouthes. However, they have an extremely sensitive sense of touch and an ability to extend their proprioception (the ability to tell where your body is in space) to outside their bodies. Their bodies and limbs are thin and bony, but strong. Ubs stand at around 16 feet tall, but weight about as much as a human.

Ma-Istu: an extremely powerful yet peaceful race. Their heads are similar to that of a humanoid dragon, as are their limbs. However, they have 10 arms with hands, and no legs with feet. Their bodies end at the torso, so they move around either by shuffling or by grabbing objects and pulling themselves forward. They are a huge race, at 500 feet.

Astral Jelly: odd, living goo that floats in bulk in outer space. Nobody knows how intelligent it is, but it has the ability to form into complex shapes, and seems to be able to tell the difference between living beings, artificial objects, and common space debris.

You can choose to start a story with one of these choices, or think of your own race, which I strongly encourage.
1.title: Meet the Aliens

11.content: Only one more question: are you an alien or a human?
11.title: Xexi

12.content: Just one question: are you a human or an Ub?
12.title: Ubs

choices: Ubs treat less-advanced humans as babies or children  (they need help and care)
They treat humans more like animals
122.content: How do the Ubs treat humans?
122.title: I'm a Human

13.content: Are you an alien or a human?
13.title: Ma-Istu

131.content: You're a Ma-Istu... male or female?
131.title: Ma-Istu Gender

1311.content: You're a male Ma-Istu, but what's your job?
1311.title: Farmer Ma-Istu?

choices: A bunch of very small creatures
13111.content:
So far, today has not been out of the ordinary. You awoke at the crack of dawn as usual, and now you are tending to today's harvest. With one hand you haul the produce bin, and with the other nine you unearth your popular eu-ener, the tastiest root vegetable known to your people, the Ma-Istu. For twenty years you have owned this farm, and by now you can be as productive as ever without even thinking of what you are doing. Instead, you think about the new discovery that today's top astronomers broadcast last night. The news that life positively exists on other worlds is especially interesting to you, who has lived alone, save for your robotic machinery, for the past twenty years.

You snap out of your thoughts when the soil bursts from the ground a little ways off. You sigh at your rotten luck, but then remember that the meteorite showers had already occured this year. Shuffling up with curiosity, you approach the object that fell from the sky. The object is about half the size of your head, but is not shaped naturally. With one hand, you gently lift the object, then hold it steady with three more. Looking closer, your eyes widen: this thing is made out of manufactured metal. You are excited; this object must have come from intelligent life from another world. Judging from its small size, its probably only a test craft, but you still handle the object with great care so as not to damage it.

You bring the alien craft closer to your head to see it in either great detail, and you notice very faint sounds coming from inside. Slowly turning the craft over in your hands, you can feel under a finger a part of the craft covered with glass. Even more intrigued, you wipe away the soil from the craft. Your eyes widen when you see what is inside.
13111.title: Crash Landing

choices: Keep the bug as a pet.
131111.content:
A living creature! And it's unlike any other creature you've ever seen or heard about, so your guessing about the testing craft coming from an alien civilization is confirmed.

Well, you think, it's quite understandable that whoever sent the miniature ship into space has placed some lifeform inside it: since this is probably a reduced model of the ships the aliens are planning to use for space travel, they're trying to find out if life is able to survive inside those flying machines. The answer is clearly yes, since the creature inside the craft is moving and producing strange fleeble sounds. But those sounds seem to be moans of pain... well, of course the little being is hurt after that impact! And the tiny space traveller must be dazed, in fact it apparently hasn't noticed your presence outside.

You peer though the glass window for a better look at the creature. Judging from its size (no larger than the smallest of the phalanxes of your fingers), it must be an insect, and it's actually covered by a shining carapace, coloured like the smallest of the Three Suns (that's a mix of purple and orange); the only uncovered part of the body is the head, which is pink on the front and sports an odd tuft of brown hair on the back.
What really seems odd to you about that bug is the fact it has only four limbs, and apparently only a couple eyes on the top of the front part of its head. Well, it's an alien bug, so you shouldn't be surprised if it's different from insects of your planet.

"What should I do now?" you wonder, tenderly cradling the spacecraft in your hands as if it was a baby Ma-Istu.

You know it's your duty, as a good citizen, to carry the alien object and its occupant to the authorities... but you suddenly imagine the little bug being dissected in some lab, an idea which makes you cringe. Sure, it's just a bug, but you has always loved animals, so that you even try to not step on insects while tending to your vegetables, and kill insect only when they're dangerous for your plants.
You think for some moments... what if you carry only the craft to the city, and keep the small traveler a secret? Yes, that seems a good idea; after all, authorities and scientists would be mostly interested in finding a way to communicate with the intelligent race which built the object, a simple bug would be of relatively lesser interest for them.

But once you've decided to not give the bug to authorities, you must face the dilemma of what to do with the tiny creature.

Should you let it free in the forest? That's an unknown environment for the alien bug, could it be able to survive there?

Or should you keep the bug with you and take care of it? You've lived alone so much time, that even the company of a pet bug could turn out pleasant for you. Beside, the insect is certainly a lab specimen, so it must be used to captivity.
131111.title: Space Traveling Bug

1311112.content:
Closely scrutinizing the tiny alien bug, you find yourself drawn to the little thing. You cannot see how this creature could possibly survive in the wild if it is injured. You feel great pity for the bug; it must be frightened stiff from its long journey. You decide that the right thing to do first is to let the bug out of its prison.

Carefully, you wipe the soil off the rest of the craft, looking for some sort of hatch you can open. You find two, but they are disappointingly small; barely larger than the insect itself. You concentrate very carefully so you do not damage the craft, and with a few tiny twists of an almost invisible knob, the door swings open. Now you are even more careful than before as you lightly shake the craft over two of your open palms. After a few minutes the bug finally falls out, landing safely on your hand.

The bug is obviously greatly distressed. After landing in your palm, it immediately tries to run away from you. You feel sorry for the bug, but also ponder how pathetic its attempts to run away are. It is surprisingly slow for a bug, and apparently very uncoordinated, as it tripped over the scales of your palm several times. You try to comfort it by petting with your finger, but this causes it to curl up into a ball of sorts and start quivering. You figure that it wil be a while before you can make the bug feel comfortable again. Cupping a few of your hands around it, you slowly shuffle back to your domicile.

You place the spaceship gently on a countertop, and decide to deal with that later. First, you want to help your pet feel better. You figure that the best way to do this is to...
1311112.title: Pet Bug

13111122.content:
You can hear the bug making squeking sounds, which seem to be more and more pained, while it squirms on your hand.

Observing it more closely, you notice its right forepaw is dangling limp, and the bug often touches the right side of its torso with its left forepaw... besides, you see a red liquid dripping out of the opening on the lower front part of its head, and guess it's blood.

You cringe in pity for the little being, realizing it must be hurt worse than you thought at first. It need medical treatment right now, but you can't take it to the vet, who probably wouldn't know how to heal an alien creature better than how could you; besides, the secret about the little space traveler would be blown out that way.
Having to care care of your "guest" yourself, you can think of an only way to help it: the Life Flower.

Life Flower is a plant gifted with amazing healing power, able to accelerate the healing process of the body of all the animals which are known on your world; luckily, in your kitchen you have a big bowl of powder made out from that plant... you just hope that medicine will have the same good effects on that bug.

You quickly fill a small cup with water and pour a bit of powder in it: green bubbles immediately start to form.

"Good luck, my little one." you utter, tilting your hand and allowing your pet to slide down toward the water.
13111122.title: Life Flower

131111221.content:
When the little bug hits the treated water, it starts to splash a bit, and you worry that it might drown. What is equivalent to a small sip to you is larger than a bathtub to your pet.

However, you are relieved when the bug seems to get the right idea. It stops struggling and relaxes on the surface of the water. Looking closer, you are surprised how well the Life Flower is treating the bugs ailments. Its right forelimb straightens out, and the gash on its head has greatly reduced in size. When the green bubbles fizzle down, the bug looks as good as new.

You reach into the cup, and are overjoyed when the bug does not flee your finger and thumb. Gently lifting it onto an open palm, you try stroking your pet again. Instead of resisting you like last time, the bug does nothing, but seems to enjoy your gentle touch. You continue to stroke your pet, and think about the fun you will have with your little alien friend.
131111221.title: The Beginnings of Trust

choices: You understand that the bug is an intelligent being.
1311112212.content:
Dean tried to relax under the gentle stroking, finally starting to realize that his captor wasn't going to hurt him.

The young astronaut had earlier thought two times that he was going to die: the first time when his craft had been hit by an asteroid and had crashed, and the second time when he had found himself in the hands of an impossibly huge beast, which looked too much like the dragon of legends.

Dean hadn't had any doubt that he was going to be crushed or devoured, and was understandably terrified, especially when he had been lowered into a liquid that seemed to boil. "So that's my fate." he had thought then. "Cooked and eaten as a snack by a giant reptile savage..."
Much to his surprise, the liquid wasn't hot again, and he had gotten stunned, seeing and feeling all his injuries being healed in a matter of minutes, a new vigor coming into him, while the giant looked down to him with a satisfied smile.

It was then that Dave had realized that the giant was just going to help him, and had smiled in relief, swimming in the refreshing water.

The young man had been actually nervous, when the trunk sized fingers had reached down for him, but he was starting to trust the giant and hadn't struggled while being picked up.
Now, while he was gently petted in a comforting manner, Dave was sure than the colossus had good intentions and was intelligent, so he decided it was time for starting a communication with the alien.

Sitting on the immense palm, he looked up at the giant's smiling face looming high above him, and raised his voice to talk to the alien.
"I thank you for rescuing me from the crashing and healing me; I owe you my life." He smiled sincerely, then continued: "My name's Dave, and I came here from a planet called Earth, I'm an explorer with the mission to find intelligent forms of life on other worlds... and I'm glad to have found you. Please, can you take me to your authorities? Or can you help me to fix my space craft? I need to get in contact with my planet."
1311112212.title: Dave the Astronaut

choices: Take the ship to the city
Play a game with your pet
13111122122.content:
You look at the tiny bug in your palm. If you listen closely, you can hear it making very soft noises. You find it very cute; it's almost as if the bug is trying to thank you. You quietly tell it that it is welcome, as you continue to stroke its tiny frame.

Still holding your pet, you look around your home for a suitable place to keep your pet. You find the perfect spot on a pedestal in your den, next to your bed. With two hands, you tear off a piece of clot with from a bedsheet, and gather a bit of fluff from your av-wi down pillow with another hand. With these, you make a little bed that your pet can sleep in. You are not worried about the bug escaping, since it seems to like you, and it would be critically injured if it jumped off the pedestal.

Of course, it is still far too early to sleep now. You think that now may be a good time to bring the alien spaceship to the city where scientists can study it and try to contact its creators. However, you also want to spend time with your tiny pet now that it trusts you. Ultimately, you decide to ...
13111122122.title: Babble

choices: Continue to make the bug feel comfortable.
131111221222.content:
You ultimately decide that the ship can wait. It is not like a few hours, or even a few days, will matter much in the long run. Besides, you will probably have a hard time convincing anyone that it is a real spaceship anyways. Since it is so small they will probably think it is an elaborate hoax you are trying to pull off. If you went now it might be hours before you could get back home. It would not be a good idea to leave a pet alone for that long a time in a strange environment.

You decide to spend some time with your pet. If you spent some time playing with the little alien it might feel more comfortable in its new home. But what could you do with the little alien? It was far too small to play most games you would play with a normal sized pet. A few things you could think of might be frightening to your tiny pet. After some silent contemplation you finally come up with something.

It should be possible to knock out two problems at once. You needed to find out what the alien ate as well. Most animals could be trained using food and this one should not be an exception, unless the creatures from its world do not eat anything. That is very doubtful though. Since you are a farmer you do have a wide variety of fresh fruit and vegetables available to you and you gather up the bug in one hand and a small piece of fruit or a vegetable in the other nine.

You let the bug see what you have in each hand and it studies the fruit intensely. Then you place each of the nine fruit and vegetable bearing hands behind your back. You had expected the creature to start gesturing wildly in the direction of the arm that held the food it had liked the most. There was the possibility that it might not have liked anything and paced around in the palm of your hand instead.

What really happened came as a complete surprise. The little bug pointed straight at one of your arms almost immediately. There was a purpose in its movements that seemed like it belonged to an intelligent creature. It was like the bug had figured out what you were doing far faster than a mere bug should be able to do. Well, it was an alien bug. Maybe the bugs on its homeworld were smarter than the ones on your world.

You presented the food item to the bug and it accepted it a little hesitantly. It seemed to be cautious of the new food, but it started nibbling at it eventually. Once it tasted the fruit it had selected its hesitation vanished. You smiled down at the little bug as it enjoyed its meal. All in all, that seemed like a good way to play a game with the bug. No harm was done and this should be a fun way of introducing the bug to new food.
131111221222.title: Pick and Choose

choices: Tell him about the tiny alien
Don't mention the alien; say something else
1311112212222.content:
Just as your pet was finally becoming friendly with you, a loud knocking came from your door, frightening your pet again. You gently stroke your pet to calm it down, but wonder who could be at your door. You do not want to reveal that you have an alien in your house, and don't want to leave your pet unattended, so you palm your pet in one of your hands under your thumb. After checking to see that your pet is both safe and obscured from view, you walk to the door and open it up. A fellow Ma-Istu walks in, but he is not a farmer. Judging from his uniform, he looks like he works for the government. After greeting him with a handshake (being careful not to shake with the hand you are holding your pet in), the person introduces himself as a top astronomer, and gives you the news.

"A few hours ago, my radar picked up electronic signals in the sky that were unlike that of any of our planet's technology. It seemed to swerve and land on your farm, and I tracked the projectile motion directly to the crater I saw in your vegetable patch."

You know that you can't deny that something landed on your farm; this Ma-Istu knows too much. You gesture to the craft on the shelf, and the astronomer picks it up gently and curiously. You are nervous that he may find out about your pet; what would the government do to an alien? A horrible image of your pet being dissected crosses your mind, and it will not leave your mind. Unfortunately, the scientist notices that you look uncomfortable.

"Are you alright sir? Is there something that you want me to know about this craft?"
1311112212222.title: The Skywatcher

choices: You'll hide the bug inside a closet.
13111122122222.content:
"Er, well, I was wondering...." you say hesitantly, thinking of a plausible excuse you could give for your nervousness, without mentioning your precious bug, "Is it possible that this ship was, uh, inhabited? I mean, I know it's very small, but could it have carried any form of life? I didn't find any living being inside, nor nearby the landing area, but I'm worried about my farm being infested."

The astronomer watches you silently for a moment, and you hope your acting was good; your speech had also the purpose of finding out if authorities were going to search around your farm for aliens... if that's the case, you'll have to be extremely careful about your pet.

Finally your guest speaks. "At this point, it's impossible to tell if this ship was meant to carry lifeforms or not, since its technology is clearly very different from ours. We'll probably send someone here soon, to search the area... of course, you'll be payed for all the inconveniences... and I'm sure you'll contact the authorities for any anomaly you could notice in your property."

Your fears are confirmed! But you hide your disappointment well, and soon the astronomer tells you goodbye and goes away, carrying the ship.

Once you and your pet are alone, you lift the bug before your eyes and sigh, telling it: "Well, that spares me to go to the city... but now, my little one, I'll have to find a good hiding place for you."
13111122122222.title: Problems

choices: There is no need to hide it just yet.
131111221222222.content:
It was hard coming up with a good hiding place. If they suspected something had escaped from that craft they were likely to look everywhere for your little bug. Even your house was likely to go through with a thorough investigation. Hiding the bug anywhere just would not due.

You tried to think back. There had to be a good place to hide the bug somewhere in the house. Then you remember something your father had told you once. When he was helping to build your house he had said he had built a special compartment into your room. He had said it would be hard for anyone else to find unless they already knew where it was. Your father had explained that you never knew when you would need a place to hide something.

At the time you had thought him a little paranoid. Now it appeared you would have to thank him for his foresight. His thinking would probably help save your little pet from a gruesome fate. The only problem was going to be finding that hiding place. You vaguely remember where your father told you he had put that hiding place. Since you had never really thought you were going to need it you had not being paying close attention to your father when he had explained just where the compartment was.

You walk back to your room and place the bug down on your bed. Then you begin your search for the compartment. Every once and a while you check on the bug to make sure it is not trying to escape. It is odd that every time you look at it the bug is staring right back at you. That sort of focused intensity is odd in an animal. You are just happy it is not trying to get away or you would have to spend even more time trying to catch it over and over again.

After some time you start to get frustrated and a little scared. Finding the compartment is proving even more difficult than you had thought it would be. Then you heard a faint noise. You looked up to see that your pet was trying to get your attention. It was pointing at something as if it wanted you to see it. When you did look where it was pointing you were startled to find what you had been looking for all along.

For a second you thought that the bug might actually be intelligent. Then you dismissed that thought. There was no way something that small could be an intelligent creature. It was a smart bug though and you let it know that by petting it gently a couple of times. Then you started putting some supplies into the compartment so the bug would be safe if you had to store it in there for a while. It would not take much and there was a lot of space. You did not know what your father thought you would need to hide, but the compartment was almost two thirds your size. The bug should be able to survive weeks in the compartment with all the things you place in it.

You think about making that your pet’s home for now. It might be a good idea to get it used to its home now. If you had to store it in there when the government came searching for aliens it might try to escape at a very bad time if it was not used to the compartment. But, you had reservations about storing your pet away like that. It seemed a little cruel to keep a pet in some hole instead of out in the open.
131111221222222.title: Hiding Place

13112.content: Could he be a noble?
13112.title: Noble?

choices: I am Astral Jelly (good luck being in character)
14.content: Are you a human or a blob?
14.title: Astral Jelly

15.content: Or the aliens could be...
15.title: More choices

151.content:
Ora-ze: creatures that are peace loving but have a power that can make other peoples dreams and nightmars come into their world. They look like a zora and a human put together but have both scales and skin.



Vpa-kinor: These creatures can be a little mean if you offend their all water city. They are water like creature but can shape their water like body into anything they want to. Their weakness is bad water!
151.title: Water-breathing creatures.

152.content: And are these spiders smaller or bigger than humans?
152.title: Intelligent Spiders

1522.content:
THe Rheeks look a lot like our spiders... spiders that are around 70 feet long, and more than 40 feet tall, and are covered by black fur with red stripes.

But they actually are quite different from true arachnids, having a dozen legs instead of eight and six red eyes on their heads. But most of all, they're herbivores, and their huge fangs are needed to break the very hard fruits which are their main food. They grab objects either with their fangs, either with the tips of their legs, covered in a sticky substance.

Rheeks live in the immense forests covering their home planet, on trees extending toward the sky for miles and miles, and their homes are webs hanging from the branches, built in an elaborate style... in fact, Rheeks aren't just beasts but instead possess an advanced technology, and even know interstellar travel, though they're mostly interested in it for catching pets on other planets.

Rheeks actually always search for new pets, since they're a peaceful yet mischievous and playful race, always needing new ways to have fun.

Now.... who are you?
1522.title: Rheeks

15221.content:
You feel quite happy today, while you climb up and down the Blue Tree, one of the trees which have been turned into recreational centers by your race.
Playfully chasing your friends, and being chased by them, you swing gracefully from branch to branch, grabbing one web string after another, inhaling the pleasant fragrance of the blue flowers and sometimes lapping their sweet nectar.

The cause of your happiness is the fact that today exactly seven Cicles have passed from your birth, and you've officially reached adulthood. A party is being prepared for you, and you can't wait to see the present your parents have chosen.

Seeing the sun being at its zenith, you realize it's the time for the party, and jump on a spiderweb bridge leading to another tree, heading home, followed by your friends.

Your house, made of spiderwebs like every house and street of your city, hangs from a massive tree with purple leaves and shining golden flowers, and purple and gold are the colours your den is painted with; you always liked your home, and feel even happier approaching it.

Hearing the sounds of your parents' and siblings' voices chatting inside, you shiver in excitement, wondering what your present is going to be....
15221.title: Birthday

152211.content:
"Come in, Bolho, your gift is ready!" your father calls. Swinging the shutter to the den open, your six beady eyes widen, thus becoming less beady, as your father presents you with your gift. Of course, it is traditionally wrapped completely in silk, but from the size and length of it, it looks a bit like a short stick.

"I picked it out myself," boasted your older sister. "I was sure that you were ready, now that your a big Rheek." Greedily ripping apart the silk, you see the cutest little thing! A small, bare, pink creature lay peacefully in your legs , breathing softly as it slept. Oddly, it had only four legs itself: something you have not seen before. Excited with the prospect of owning your very own alien, you thank your parents quickly.

You are impatient to play with your new pet, so you shake it vigorously in the hopes of it waking up. Slowly, it stirs, and you bring it close to your face, so it can have a good look at its new owner. The four-legged alien opens its eyes, and then ...
152211.title: Little Four-Legs

1522111.content:
You're pretty strtles when the little pet screams, and starts to struggle wildly, though it isn't match for your powerful legs, which are gripping it firmly.

"Hey, why is the little runt getting crazy?" you ask.

Your big sister chuckles. "It's not domesticated." she explains. "I caught it from a nest on its homeplanet and sedated it. It's up to you to tame the little pest!"

"Oh, thank you for the nice trick." you reply, but without anger: in fact, you're intrigued by this challenge.

"My son, taming a wild animal, but also taking care of it, is a big responsibility." your father says. "That's going to be your first test for adulthood."

You nod, feeling very proud, and use one of your forelegs to lift your pet: that's easy, because the skin of the animal gets glued by the sticky liquid dripping from the tip of your leg at your will.
Lifting the trembling beast again before your eyes, you tell it softly: "Don't worry, little one, I'll take great care in turning you into a good pet. First of all, I', going to...."
1522111.title: Responsibilty

choices: Bond with your pet; play with it
Train your pet; teach it descipline
15221111.content:
You always had the top grades in web-weaving class at school, and today is going to be your first time making practical use of your skills. While trying to comfort your pet in two forelegs, you swiftly and deftly get to work with four of your hindlegs. Producing sticky and sturdy silk from your spinnerets, you weave a fine ball-shaped cage for your pet. As you do this, you also climb up the walls of the den to your corner. Throwing several sticky strands to the ceiling and tying it to the basket, you introduce your pet to its new hanging cage.

You shove the pet in the hole and, so it doesn't fall out, quickly seal the hole. There are plenty of air holes, and you can easily see your pet inside through them. However, your new pet doesn't look too happy. It seems to want to get out, since it shakes the silken strands vigorously.

You think about what to do. You really like your pet and do not want to see it unhappy like this, but you also want to be a good master. You think about what might be the best thing to do right now as a pet owner.
15221111.title: Cage Weaving

152211112.content:
You go and talk to your father. "Dad, the little animal is a difficult one, it keeps fighting. What should I do?"

"Your pet must realize that it's under your power and control now, and that its life lies in your legs." your father explains. "You should do something to make him feel your power."

"I don't want to hurt it." you protest.

He shakes his head. "I haven't told you to do that. Just do something to show it how much it is powerless compared to you, and it'll understand it has to obey you."

"What should I do?" you ask.

"That's up to you to decide." your daddy quietly answers.

"But you'll decide later." your mother intervenes. "Now it's time for your party and banquet.

You nod excitedly, and run toward the center of the nest, where all your loved ones are gathered around a huge pile of colourful fruits... and the party begins....

A few hours later, when your friends and siblings have left and your parents are napping in their corner, you approach the cage, having formed a plan in your mind. Peering through the holes, you see you pet crouched on the bottom in an apparently depressed state; but when the little beast sees you, it jumps up immediately, clearly scared, and it squeaks in terror when the cage door is opened and one of your forelegs reaches inside for it. The four-legged creature tries desperately to scramble away, but it's useless, and it is soon captured and dragged out.

Then, the little being makes a surprised sound when you wrap a spiderweb string around its waist
You chuckle, seeing how your pet makes frantic attempts to free himself. "Little one, you'll have to get used to be leashed." you say. "And that's going to be your first lesson."

Then you place the beast on the floor, and it starts to run, just like you imagined.
A little tug from you, who are holding the other side of the string, is enough to cause your pet to fall on its back. It jumps up and start to run away, with the same result."

"You can't escape your master." you say proudly. "You'd better to understand that."
152211112.title: Training

choices: The pet tries to grab the fruit.
The pet doesn't show any reaction.
1522111122.content:
But the little animal jumps up again, and once more it is dragged back by your powerful leg, while you shake your head in disappointment.

"Mmmmh, little one, you shouldn't disappoint your master this way." you scold it, but that's no use: the pet keeps attempting to run away, every time falling when you pull its leash, and eventually the beast lies down on the floor, panting. You notice some water dripping down from its two eyes, and can just hope that isn't a sign of bad health.

You muse ... how can you convince that stubborn animal that it must obey you?
After some moments, you make a decision and pick your pet up, carrying it toward a small room... where your family keeps all the food!

"The best way to get to a beast's heart is through its somach." you think, and lift a big blue fruit, that you know is very sweet, then you keep it suspended above the pet.
1522111122.title: Food

15222.content:
You've had a very bad dream last night, you were rocked about, taken aboard some giant spaceship, and wrapped up into a parcel, that's when you wake up...

In the Parcel.

You scream and no reply, you try to break open the cardboard walls of the parcel, but they're as hard as concrete. You pinch yourself, you don't wake up. The air in the parcel is nearing to nothing and you cannot reach the top, even by jumping. To the top of the parcel must be 10 ft. The air is wearing thin now and all you can do is lie down and die.

Then your parcel opens with a rip. You can barely see as much light has hit you in less than a fraction of a second. All you can do is shout, "Hello?" and you wait for a reply...one comes...

In an incoherent language. Then your eyes fix on a huge spider, 60ft tall at least...and the worst thing is, you always had this phobia, arachnophobia. The giant arachnid just stares at you, and you scream and try to jump out of the parcel...and you hit your head on the side of the cardboard wall and fall onto a huge hand. You think you're about to be eaten...
15222.title: strange dreams and parcels

A Glowni is a small humanoid the size of a child who have large heads and bodys and hands for their size, they also have short tails, blue fur,
black hair and can glow in the dark.....They are Intellegent
Only females have long black hair..Males only grow fur...they have dark blue eyes

1552.title: Glowni's

15523.content:
This little race is known as a Dobamay.

A Dobamay is a furry,rather small heightened creature,the highest recorded,so far,is 3 feet.Their whole body is similar to chibis,and they are covered in a fuzzy gray-toned fur,and they have only one,yellow eye,with a black pupil.Despite their messy looks,they are actually well groomed,this is because of their long tongue,located below their eyes,that can reach any part of their body.It can also be used to reach object out of their reach.There is a gland in their small,almost non-existent neck,that allows them to copy the vocals of the objects.


Notes:

~Females are curvier,mostly around what appears to be the hips and thighs,and have lighter toned fur.They are also known to be more friendly,and their small mouths are easier to spot under their eye.

~Males are more active,slightly taller,and have darker toned fur than females.They are also less friendly than females,but it isn't impossible to earn their trust.

~A Dobamay's eye is not as sensitive as a human's.Poking it does not hurt them,but they are sensitive to who,and what is touching it
15523.title: Dobamays

155231.content:
What are you?

a Human

a Dobamay
155231.title: what are you?

choices: Be an inbuer, or its host
155232.content: Inbuers: Swarms of Viruses with the ability to insert themselves into the DNA of any living thing. They can then communicate with this being. They can then change the DNA of their host into anything, combined with a few other tricks that they have learnt they can then change their host into anything or give it pretty much any superpower. Millions of years ago they used this power to enslave their hosts and conquer the galaxy. A rebellions in favour of their hosts rights turned into a war that spanned the whole galaxy, between the war and self destruction brought about by the sheer guilt of what they'd almost went extinct. Those that remains roam the universe looking for rights to wrong and problems to solve to seek an absolution that they will never permit themselves.
155232.title: Inbuers

info.brief_description: A story of alien races that have never existed before.
info.description:
This interactive will contain intelligent and semi-intelligent races of aliens, never before seen or heard of by humanity. There are a few limits to what aliens appear, but any new ideas are welcome:

-The alien must not be an exact duplicate of a human or any other creature on Earth

-The alien must be original; nothing stereotypical or from popular media

-The alien may be an anthropomorph, but if you choose to do this, try to make it different than a "normal" anthro

Other than this, your alien may be any shape or size, as humanoid or as amorphous as you want. A few other things about this story:

-This interactive is rated 13+, so keep foul language and adult themes as low as you can; complete absence of these is preferred

-The story must contain both aliens and humans, but can be told from the point of view of either race.
